name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, StoatLad, NeoNaoNeo)

name: mercuri0us
text: Yes, and then I chubbied her.

name: mysterymeat1001
text:
Honestly, it was like my university's president saying "I'm glad there weren't too many beach balls this year" at my graduation.

It was my honor to stand up at that moment, yell "YEE HAW!", and spike the beach ball I'd been quietly inflating all ceremony into the crowd.

The president stood for a moment, watching it dance in the air above the graduating class. Then, he turned and walked off without another word.

name: sortelli
text: I have to admit that is pretty sweet.

name: plummet
text: The Colonel Wins Again.

name: drskradley
text: The "YEE HAW!" did it for me.  Such exclamations are not done enough in this world.

name: tekende
text: This is good. This is a good story about a beach ball.

name: gunsofray
text: Mysterymeat launched his beach ball and he saw that it was good. (Bible stuff)

name: falseprophet
text:
I truly appreciate how your 'lame parade' has a train whistle for some reason.

In other news, the citywide gay parade uses a foghorn to announce itself.

name: little_angry_plum
text: A comment left by little_angry_plum was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by HonestTom, StoatLad, NeoNaoNeo, Bophur, SchnappM, jamers, wae, DeimosRising, StagnantDisplay, lamelliform, Meetzorp, woodenteeth, Japong, Soilentshuggah, Baryonyx, BrianNotBrian, HurfusDurfus, charchar, NigelChaos, clintisiceman, Mastronaut, SPECTRE)

name: budenhagen
text: I'm laming you because such an act as eating a dick would be most unwelcome to all parties involved.

name: budenhagen
text: AAAND I accidently clicked Chubby.

name: drskradley
text:
In high school, a phrase went around of telling people to "eat a dick", which was inevitably followed by (from the mouth of the same person) "eat two and choke".

Now, I ask you, if you had just warned me that I was going to choke if I did so, why would I still eat two dicks? Teenage logic just ain't what it used to be.

name: norrin
text: You would if everyone else was doing it. That is teenage logic.

name: drskradley
text: Touche, good man.

name: boredom_man
text: My name is Jonathan Penton and you suck like a motherfucker.

name: seanbad
text: little_angry_plum, this is your intervention. There's no easy way to say this... You care too much about Internet Problems. We all love you and want you to be happy, but you are hurting us. Please, get help.

name: wae
text:
I hate the lames, but honesty compels me to let you know that I feel the same way.

I see the humor, and I appreciate the richness of the characterization, but it just doesn't quite do it for me laughs-wise.

name: drskradley
text: And that, my friends, is why we have the rating system instead of simply rating a strip via chubbies or lames for those who love or hate it, respectively - obviously, going by its current score of 3.6, it hasn't done it for many of us, laughs-wise.

name: philosophe
text: Best Friday facts ever . Mostly due to 2/5ths of it being Lie Bot.

name: skoora
text: Dissenting opinions? Fuck that mess!

name: fosters
text: You are doing a really terrible job of ignoring them, what with all the complaining.

name: hbaranov
text: Dr. Mohid Prashad's Celery Wine for Thinkers? Alcohol that regrows braincells? Damn, that really is not hte good stuff.

name: spinynorman
text: It's just manishevitz with ground up wallets.

name: norrin
text: The secret to making people think something is good for them is to make it taste like it's not supposed to be edible. Ground up wallets will achieve this.

name: spinynorman
text:
Hilariously enough, I originally wanted to write "walnuts." I didn't realize what I had typed until I skimmed back through this just now, a week later.

Wallets? What the fuck?

name: tekende
text: You have caused me to make embarrassing noises at work for the past three or four minutes in an attempt to stop laughing. Good work.

name: meetzorp
text:
Wallets is WAY funnier than walnuts.

Manishevitz infused with walnut would be kinda gross, but Manishevitz infused with wallet? Completely undrinkable. Hence, total Pat-hooch.

name: charchar
text: The celery crop was blighted this year, and we had to make do with artichokes , good sir.

name: budenhagen
text: w00t, my vote made a difference for once!

name: straw
text: If you think that's so, try changing your vote in a couple hours.

name: phy
text: Flash-tried cheesecake. That's where the Flash tries some, and then you get to have it. You can almost taste the Speed Force.

name: falseprophet
text: You cook it by vibrating its molecules.

name: straw
text: So, putting it in the microwave?  Maybe Ray has one of those industrial microwaves.

name: lawbot
text:
NO IT IS TRIED IN A COURT OF LAW VERY QUICKLY
THE FEAR CHANGES THE STRUCTURE GIVING IT A NEW FLAVOUR AND TEXTURE

name: phy
text: "Flash-tried" cheesecake. That's after the "citywide" "manhunt"?

name: gormster
text: I think that one might need a link

name: gormster
text: I think that's how you cook everything.

name: molesticide
text: why does the flash get to try some?  what did that guy ever do for me?

name: vandenbos
text: Do you suppose he fights evil telepathic gorillas and guys with cold guns for fun, then?

name: spectre
text: And he has to wear tights to work. They chafe.

name: soticoto
text:
This strip gets a 1 because Ray committed grievous heresy against Cheesecake!

BURN HIM!
STONE HIM!
QUARTER HIM!

name: mattylite
text: The cake is a lie.

name: plummet
text: sigh

name: soticoto
text: You are now an ingredient of cake.

name: rene
text: Most horses have eyes the color of meatballs, don't they? Does that mean that they all have to die? That would be a saddest thing.

name: girdag
text: What kind of crazy horses have you been looking at?

name: biff
text: Crazy Horse is a dead indian chief, and his eyes were reportedly a dark brown color that could be described as the color of meatballs .

name: straw
text: What meatballs have you been eating?

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I have never seen so many horse and meatball misconceptions strung together.
Meatball-colored eyes.. that is ghastly.

name: rene
text: Are we talking about beef meatballs here? Like the ones you eat in a marinara sauce with some spaghetti noodles? Because those ones are a nice reddish-brown color that is almost exactly the same color as most horses eyes. If we are talking about those grey ones that come with lumpy gravy in cafeteria food, I apologize.That would be disgusting.

name: overmedicated
text: That would not be an Italian restaraunt I would frequent.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Well, I'm seeing it more as eyes that look like they had been replaced by meatballs. They are dull, oozy, and not at all what a healthy eye looks like.
It's not that I think Philippe imagined meatballs for eyes, but that the eyes were so terribly diseased that they resemble meatballs, and his only way to describe it in his five-year-old vernacular is 'meatball colored.'
Or I'm completely wrong and a sick fuck, but c'est la vie, all you know about me is that I, too, am From the Internet.

name: plummet
text:
*slow clap*

Bravo, sir. BRAVO.

name: varnish
text: They shoot crazy horses, don't they?

name: anitrophaeron
text: Custer tried to but that didn't work out too well.

name: audhumla
text: i was all set to make a joke like that, but alas...

name: powderfinger
text: nah, neil young just makes shittier albums without them

name: spectre
text: wish I had a chubby left for this.

name: ford
text: I realized, after i chubbied powderfinger's post for you, that wishing out loud for an extra chubby is actually a great way to net several

name: varnish
text: I was all set to pass on this one, when I saw that last line about Sun-Inured Raita. That filled my mind with some pretty frightening ideas.

name: drsad
text: Raita is made from yogurt... but isn't Pat a vegan?  Is the sun-inured variety somehow non-dairy?

name: lawbot
text: SOYA-BASED YOGHURT-BASED RAITA

name: biff
text: Is this the first time a character has acknowledged that Lie Bot makes stuff up? It is the first time I remember, and I just reread all the strips a week or so ago. But Roast Beef's admonition not to take this stuff too much to heart seems to relate directly to LB's mendacity.

name: hyetal
text:
Oh, that's what LB stands for. Duh...

I was sitting here saying to myself: "What's Lyle's last name...?"

name: ortsac
text: It's Gabriel

name: wae
text:
HA! I did the exact same thing.

I was sitting here knowing I could think of what it stood for, but I knew it'd be easier to just ctrl-f on it in the comments section.

All week. I have been at work ALL WEEK.

name: charchar
text:
chubby for teaching me ctrl-f.

Now I kind of want to go ctrl-(every blessed letter of the alphabet) and see what happens.

If my computer implodes and sends me into Olde Dinosaure Tymes, tell my mother I love her and I'm sorry I shoved all my dirty clothes under the bed.

name: hyetal
text:
Now I kind of want to go ctrl-(every blessed letter of the alphabet) and see what happens.

This is the appropriate attitude when using a computer.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i always wondered!

name: lateadopter
text: Lie Bot has taken in Philippe, Cornelius, and Ray, among others, but I don't think I've seen Roast Beef falling for his fibs.  Perhaps RB's general lack of enthusiasm makes him less susceptible to Lie Bot's wiles.

name: flazisismuss
text: I think Beef is blessed, or cursed, with a natural cynicism that may render him immune to Lie Bot.  Ray knows better but occasionally convinces himself that what LB is saying, while untrue, is illustrative of some greater truth.  Or so it seems to me.

name: koodge
text: Beef pays attention.

name: harletron
text: He was probably in that same class with ray

name: fosters
text: Roast Beef's real name is Cassandra, after all. He knows Lie Bot is lying about absolutely everything all the time but NO ONE WILL EVER BELIEVE HIM.

name: fablesandblues
text: Early on, Teodor seems to doubt some of his stuff , but Lie Bot actually has some compelling reasoning.

name: gormster
text: His name is Lie Bot . I think some of them might have gotten the picture.

name: spectre
text: If anyone on the series would see through Liebot, it would be the Beef. Maybe I'm wrong, but he has hosed Phillipe, Ray, Pat, Vlad and Teodor, but not Mr Cornelius or Roast Beef -- am I wrong?

name: lateadopter
text: He hosed Cornelius here . This was early days, so it may not be canon any longer, who knows. Onstad, have you repudiated this strip or what?

name: kbhoyt
text: Roast Beef has just told Phillipe that Kelvin Zero is tied with Rankine Zero for slowest car.

name: andrew_
text: Phillipe and Towers been tight since old times.

text: He's to young to be an ass or breast man, he's just a tower guy...wait....damn you nolan!

text: ...I am now a breast man, and it's thanks to you, I should think.

text: [IMGS OFF]

text: Congratulations y=2*cos((2/3)*pi*(x-0.5)) 1, you are the Breast Men's Club equation of the week!

name: plummet
text: This One

name: kbhoyt
text:
Why in the hell am I getting a lame for asking a question?

Onstad fans are hell on the average joe.

name: loneal
text: I think we've gotten to the point that any time someone explicitly talks about referencing a strip, it's taken as a snide insult about referencing strips. Onstad fans aren't hell on the average joe, they're just real touchy about strip-reference competitions. Actually they are hell on the average joe, but not because of this.

name: kbhoyt
text: You get a chubby for being nice.

name: saint
text:
I have no chubbies left to leave.
please forgive me for this inexcusable lack of foresight...I have been too friendly .

On a lighter note, I have gotten better at bbcode. We have learned to coexist, at least.

text:
It's... it's mesmerizing...

Also, obligatory "THIS IS A HOMEBOY"

name: gregchant
text: As a flying buttress guy myself, I do not share Phillipe's indignation regarding the current tower situation.

name: johnnyc
text: After much deliberation, Philippe has come out in favour of towers.

name: professorhazard
text: As for me, I'll stick with fat titties.

name: lateadopter
text: Reminds me of the anecdote that Robert Redford tells in Spy Game:  "Why would I pay a man to shoot a horse that I own?"

name: javonathan
text: I like this.

name: dezufnocosem
text: Fuck Thomas Edison.

name: straw
text: Yeah, Tesla was the real OG.

name: tombsgrave
text: Alternating current, the death ray, and... it's kind of hard to top the death ray.

name: dezufnocosem
text: Indeed i heartily endorse such musings

name: straw
text: Don't forget the spindle-less turbin, wireless communication, and an earthquake machine! (This Tesla biography I'm reading is awesome!)

name: vandenbos
text: Which one is it?  I've been on the hunt for a decent Tesla biography for a bit now, but there's more than a couple to pick from and I don't know anyone who's read any of them.

name: theboneorchard
text: I started reading "Wizard" The Life and Times of Nikola Tesla. Biography of a Genius   by Marc J. Seifer.          Pretty good so far, but I put it on hold recently to study more chess books...

name: straw
text: Yep, that's the one.

name: vandenbos
text: Awesome!  Thank you both!  I'll pick it up at the bookstore later today.

name: gormster
text: Fellas! This is not the xkcd forum!

name: straw
text: Damnit!

name: soticoto
text: Any Tesla biography advocated by Zangief has to be good!

name: loneal
text: Also the machine that both replicates and teleports you, so you can finally be the prestige.

name: straw
text: No.

name: loneal
text: Haha, fair enough. I am feeling insecure because I got a friend a Tesla biography as a gift and it is not the one you mentioned above. I feel like a bad friend.

name: lateadopter
text: Yes.

name: straw
text: Well, in the introduction, he mentions a number of fine biographies he used as resources and inspiration. I'm sure your friend was gifted one of those.

name: fosters
text:
Was the earthquake machine the one he had to shut down himself, Cornelius-vs-the-computer style, with an axe, because he realized he was in the process of accidentally destroying New York with it?

Man I loved that crazy bastard. His character accidentally inventing a clone teleportation device in The Prestige was probably the most believeable thing about that movie.

name: minarch
text: "Flash-tried cheesecake" is potent enough to cause the trashiest of orgasms.

name: epicurus
text: Now Chris Onstad is just playing to my love of antiquated english parlance. Pence-upon-Breedgate? Sir Horace Pepper's Font of Ardor? Someone's been reading my wishlist.

name: neonaoneo
text: I agree with the general sentiments of this post.

name: cuneocapo

text:
Jack and Jill went up the hill
To fetch a pail of water
Jack fell down and broke his crown
I'll be placing your daughter Jill with a foster family.
OOOOHHHHH!

Yes, please tell me how I've been reading and what. You were right there up my hinder after all. Keeping a log. Great job!

text: The things at the top of this page are the strips. The strips contain words and pictures. Underneath the strips are comments explaining what people thought of the strip. These mostly only contain words.

name: baryonyx
text:
Alas, the Tower. Gone are the days in which it was an impregnable bastion against roving bands of cutthroats and brigands. Instead, it merely capacitates cell phones and bears blinking lights so that planes do not collide with them.

The Tower is in decline. I hear he is drinking.

text: [IMGS OFF]

text: Illuminated manuscripts such as this add credibility to the theory that Phileppe has been five since as early as  c.1200 A.D.

text:
It's not a manuscript it's one of the major arcana cards. You disappoint me, guy I've never met.

Also I've never understood why the tower represents bad shit going down but the death card is apparently okay. Maybe I should look it up.

name: cherubrocker22
text:
I have something to say about Achewood, and I've been meaning to say it for a while, so here goes:

In my opinion, the Philippe Times should be separate from the strip, just as the blogs, Beef's 'zine and Ray's (former?) Place are. It's not a knock on the content of Friday Facts, as it's definitely genuinely funny. But my heart always sinks when it's one of these instead of a "regular" strip with the dialogue/plot/art that made me fall in love with Achewood. That's just my perspective. I would still read the Times if it was in a separate section, but I just never understood putting it up as a "strip."

Lame me if you must, but I submit that this is a respectfully stated opinion. I invite sincere debate. In fact, I concede it's possible Mr. Onstad is pushing the boundaries of what a "strip" can be and I'm just too behind the times to appreciate it. What do you think?

name: boscostacy
text: I can dig it.

name: boscostacy
text:
Not technically replying to my own post...
This also would mean that a collected Philippe Times could be a good item for the store.

Unless it already exists. I'm too broke to go browing in there presently.

name: cherubrocker22
text:
yeah good idea, a print version makes a lot of sense.

but who the fuck are we to tell onstad how to do things? it's not like I'm gonna stop reading the strip if it's the philippe times every friday.

name: caduceo
text: Phillipe times has some funny stuff, but more then half of it just hits me as surrealist, or I'm too stupid to get the joke. like the Kelvin Zero car.

name: megamummy
text:
thats what i like about friday facts..
It got potential fat to be chewed through the weekend (if necessary).

But thats just me
the ocean (internet) is a wide place
yet this coral bed (achewood) is my home

I like how i could research frozen japanese cars
if my weekend came down to it..(cherry flavored zighter please!)

Usually i just zim-zooom! over them, glowing with antisipation for the heavy weekend of "mixed drink testing" at a "friends house".. but just in case things dont go as planned,
i can sit on the old coral,
watch fattybeaver give everyone a free chubby (thanks!) and learn something new about life (L.B..... LIE BOT?!?!)

name: shineboxx
text: Thing is, Friday Facts have been known to give us Phillipe's perspective on whatever goings-on happen to be going on at the time (Ray almost staying at "Simple Moments" in-room living while his brain got better, for instance). So this one seems like a missed chance,  seeing as the plot it interrupts was centered on Phillipe.

name: lateadopter
text: I think that reflects the fact that Philippe had no clue as to the potentially nefarious and in any case sleazy intentions of Nolan from the Internet.

name: wittyname
text: To be honest, I still haven`t finished reading it and I probably won`t.

name: kingsleymc
text: Seems phoned in.

name: abbazaba
text:
Beats Me Why Most Dudes Suck. Sure As Hell Ain't My Scene.


I think that quote is fairly appropriate here.

name: ruik
text: Is this the first time any of the cast has acknowledged that Lie Bot does, in fact, dole out fallacies?

name: caseyb3
text:
I wonder why Philippe has so much to say about shooting horses

Seems Ray had a story to tell stallion with his eyes on bad meat, and a variety of men

name: spoids
text: Dr Pepper doesn't have a period.

name: tekende
text: So Dr Pepper is either a man or on birth control, then?

name: selbencoirlo
text: Of course he is a man, the very idea of a FEMALE doctor is preposterous. The only place for women in the field of medicine is beside the doctor, holding his drinking whiskey in her right hand and his sterilization whiskey in her left. They are the same brand.

name: notcool
text:
Congratulations, you've forced me to come to grips with the fact that Dr Pepper might not be a guy's name. I honestly didn't know this was a blind spot until you pointed it out.

Same goes for Mr Pibb.

name: puguglypress
text: How cynical do you have to be to market a "Wine for Thinkers"?

name: greenkoolayd
text: cheese jerky is something im not interested in trying.

name: masterbbb26
text: I think Lie-Bot would be very bored without Philippe around
